snippet: As the U.S. economy worsened, fewer poor families received government checks. Is the European risk of long-term dependency worth assuring a minimum quality of life for everyone in a society? Or is the limited American system better?
abstract: As the U.S. economy worsened, fewer poor families received government checks. Is the European risk of long-term dependency worth assuring a minimum quality of life for everyone in a society? Or is the limited American system better?
